website_summaries.verdict: A large stainless steel scrubber that's highly durable.
pros: Constructed from a small weave chain mail
Does a good job of getting stuck-on food off your cast iron pans
cons: The links on this scrubber have a tendency to start falling off over time

customer_reviews.title: I find it best to work when the pan is still warm
customer_reviews.text: I use a lot of cast iron and have tried several different methods of cleaning them. This chain mail works for light to moderate junk. I find it best to work when the pan is still warm. I add some canola oil and rub the chain around. You'll need to find a place to keep the chain because it'll be oily and I don't clean it each time. But I find the chain easy to clean (just let it lay in the dish water for a while and rinse.) For really bad caked on layers I use "steam" cleaning, but that's seldom when I keep up with this tool.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff T.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent!
customer_reviews.text: This chain works amazing! It cuts cleaning time in half, normally when cleaning Cast iron it takes a while because you have to scrub with hot water, a sponge and elbow grease, and when you think it's clean it's probably not. This chain is nice because it won't scratch or remove the seasoning on the pan which means you don't have to season it as often. 5 stars for sure!
customer_reviews.author: C.T.

customer_reviews.title: Surprizingly Excellent Results!
customer_reviews.text: At first I was skeptical of all the 5 star reviews, but I'm a believer as it works surprisingly well! I scrubbed my pan with soap and water - in preparation for a new cover of seasoning - and though I used a Brillo pad (steel wool), I didn't make a tremendous dent in the amount of baked on stuff stuck to the pan. I then used this "wonder product" and was amazed these tiny little circles stripped away the grime. Truly impressive. I was not paid for my review so, order yours today and become a believer!
customer_reviews.author: Albert P. Hreha, Jr.

customer_reviews.title: works wonderfully on my cast iron pans
customer_reviews.text: The LauKingdom chainmail, cast iron cleaner, works wonderfully on my cast iron pans! I bought the largest size, smaller ones might work as well, but I like the large size for the increase in scrubbing surface. I only use oil in a cool pan and then scrub out the pain with the chainmail. Wipe the excess oil and grime out of the pan and then wash the chainmail scrubber in hot, soapy water and hang dry. The patina in my pans aren't affected and scrubbing with oil makes it that much better! I would definitely buy this if you are looking.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonCustomer

customer_reviews.title: Great for induction cooktop pots and pans
customer_reviews.text: After purchasing one for myself, I liked it so much that I purchased one for a friend (who loves it!). It works great for all the pots and pans used for induction cooktops: cast iron, steel, and magnetic stainless steel . I don't like to use soap so what I do after using a pan is fill it up with some water, turn up the heat, and put this Chainmail Scrubber in the pan. Once the water starts to boil, use something (spatula, chopsticks) to move the scrubber around. This method gets rid of all the stuff stuck on the pan. Best of all, when the scrubber gets dirty you can throw it in the dishwasher.
customer_reviews.author: D. Bui

customer_reviews.title: A conversation piece!
customer_reviews.text: Lets be honest, this is a weird product. Even so, it is very effective. We use it on our skillet and wok & it works beautifully. Easy to use and much more effective than any other option we have tried. Even gets the tough stuff on the bottom of the pan. This item does take some care and cleaning itself, but I would certainly say this is an overall net decrease in time spent cleaning and improvement in ease of cleaning. Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: BrianK

customer_reviews.title: Everything old is new again
customer_reviews.text: Using chain mail pads to scrub cast iron has been around since at least the 1920's. doing it with stainless brings it into the 21st century. I have made whole hauberks of chain mail, and for lightweight butted rings, this is as good as it gets. I enjoyed using this product immensely, though cleaning it up afterward to get all the grease off of it was a pain. I am going to plan on storing it somewhere it can hang up without being scrubbed for 20 minutes after use.
customer_reviews.author: richard t field

customer_reviews.title: Chain Mail for the Kitchen
customer_reviews.text: Works well cleaning cast iron pots and pans. Excellent size. Easy to use and clean. Get you tap water steaming hot, wear some dish washing gloves, and go to town on your pot or pan. However, don't be too aggressive as you can easily remove the seasoning. After cleaning the pan, add some dish detergent to the chain, rub is together in your hands, run it under hot water and it's clean. I let it dry on beer bottle so it hangs down to dry out. I've had it for a while and have not observed and rusting of the chain mail.
customer_reviews.author: Sal

customer_reviews.title: Love it and highly recommended for all you cast iron ...
customer_reviews.text: Love it and highly recommended for all you cast iron fanatics like me. Solid design and gentle. It does take a bit more elbow grease than my previous scrubber, but it also seems to damage the seasoning less for the same amount of cleanliness. It's comfortable to the touch, unlike my previous scrubber, and has been very durable. Also unlike my previous scrubber, I don't have to be worried about leaving it around the kitchen since it is attractive enough that my wife doesn't complain about it being near the sink.
customer_reviews.author: RK

customer_reviews.title: Darn-Goody-OK!
customer_reviews.text: Well, mine is not near so biggish as the 1 that I see in that cast iron skillet. That must be some puny little skillet! But it works very well. Drains quickly. No stink, no slime, no nastiness like ya get with a sponge. Or with 1 of those feeble plastic scrubber pads. This cleans out scramble-egg residue from my microwave glass bowl with pert near no effort. Im telling all the folks down at the gathering place about mine. Im probably gonna do a bit of Show-&-Tell with it!
customer_reviews.author: 85607Scotty

customer_reviews.title: Very Pleased, an Excellent Product.
customer_reviews.text: Admittedly, I customarily try, real hard, to not like certain things; there's so much junk on the market promising so much but rarely equaling the sales hype. I'm happy to say, though, this 'Cast Iron Cleaner', from LauKindom is an exception. I value my cast iron skillets and use them, mainly, for cooking up steaks which is by far the best way to cook good meat although cleanup isn't always the easiest chore. But this chain link device is a game changer: it's easy to use and does an excellent job of clearing away even the toughest problem. Cleaning the chain links is also a breeze and to dry I just set it on top a towel.
customer_reviews.author: Bill Oterson

customer_reviews.title: He is very impressed with the mesh cleaner--says it "works like a dream
customer_reviews.text: This was ordered as a gift for a relative who loves to cook with cast iron pots and pans. He is very impressed with the mesh cleaner--says it "works like a dream." It takes a little bit of practice to get accustomed to the way it works, but it's a quick study. Also, it tends to transfer some uof the mess to the user's hands; problem easily solved by wearing kitchen gloves. The mesh cleaner is much safer than a wire brush, which can be hazardous if loose bristles are ingested by accident. Our gift recipient is so pleased that he has added another mesh cleaner to his shopping list.
customer_reviews.author: Puzzler

customer_reviews.title: It works without damaging my hard-won seasoning of the Dutch oven.
customer_reviews.text: I have been always told not to use metal utensils in my Dutch Ovens so was concerned about this item. This scrubber is not in the same league as metal utensils. This scrubber has no sharp edges, prongs or welding spikes. I use it by placing it in my dirty Dutch Oven with very hot water and using the point of my wooden spoon to scoot it around the inside of the pot. It loosened all the stuck on food particles and leaves the seasoning intact. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: N. Fritz

customer_reviews.title: This thing is awesome! It even gets the brown crap off of ...
customer_reviews.text: This thing is awesome! It even gets the brown crap off of my stainless steel?! My boyfriend thought I was crazy when I bought this and thought I was even crazier when he saw it. It comes in such a small box! But when I showed him how well it worked he reluctantly accepted that it's awesome (because it is) and that I was right (because I was). However If you scrub too hard though it will wear some of the patina off of your cast iron. But you would think that it would rub all the patina off, but it doesn't. And you would think it would scratch your stainless steel but it doesn't! It's like freaking Magic.
customer_reviews.author: Chantel C.

customer_reviews.title: Great Tool
customer_reviews.text: Very Handy to have in the kitchen! Works really good getting really stuck on food off my cast iron griddle. This is a real review. I'm so glad I bought this
customer_reviews.author: Pickyme

customer_reviews.title: Best kitchen purchase in years.
customer_reviews.text: Where have you been? Why hadn't I heard about this years ago? Forget the green scrunge pads or the steel wool. This works perfect for cleaning all my cast iron without damaging the seasoning of the pans. I have also used it on my restaurant style cookie sheets for stuck on burnt on stuff and in the bottom of my stainless steel pots to remove stuck or burnt food. Try it you'll love it.
customer_reviews.author: Jack

customer_reviews.title: The links are constantly falling off every time I use ...
customer_reviews.text: The links are constantly falling off every time I use it to clean my cast iron. Aside from that, it's effective.
customer_reviews.author: Atari

customer_reviews.title: Loose rings
customer_reviews.text: 1st time out of the bag, some rings were loose already, bottom of the bag and other rings had opened and re-hooked others, causing a tangled scrubber. Still usable i guess. 1st use, several times became loose and went down the drain, I caught a few. Now to dig them or if the garbage disposal. There are other scrubbers that don't have rings that don't open OR SO THE DESCRIPTION READS. I'll be ordering those soon, depending on how easy it will be to find the lost rings down the drain. What fun that will be on my weekend. Phoooey.
customer_reviews.author: a h benny

customer_reviews.title: Works like a charm
customer_reviews.text: Works like a charm! I love cooking in my cast iron but cleaning can definitely be a huge pain. This gently scrapes off anything that is sticking or burned on without damaging the seasoning. And when I'm done I just throw it in the dishwasher. Great buy for anyone with cast iron cookware.
customer_reviews.author: Leigh Ann

customer_reviews.title: It works
customer_reviews.text: The cleaning ball is very good. It is soft and tough. It doesn't drop or scatter. The small one next to me was bought in the local store. All the new ones are silk off. It's useless to wash them once. Buy back after use. Each of them has its own package. The steel ball feels very soft and the quality is good. It solves the big problem of cleaning up the kitchen. I'm particularly satisfied. The quality of the product is very good, the function and effect are very good. It's much better than the cleaning ball I bought before. This price is worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Gerald Wagner

customer_reviews.title: Best dual cast-iron cleaning and home-defense item purchase last year
customer_reviews.text: You know, I appreciate that this is chain mail as much as the next guy, but I didn't expect to love it like I do! It worked well to get stuck food off cast-iron pan, and off a stainless steel pot that was giving us trouble once. We can clean it up quickly, too. We also play with it when it's not it use. Everyone in the family likes goofing with it. We even tried demonstrating how it would help protect you in a knife fight. ;)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Now my son volunteers to clean the cast iron skillet!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this right around the time my son started kindergarten. He has some sensory issues, so he loved running the mesh through his hands. Unbeknownst to me, on the first day of kindergarten he took it on the bus with him, tucked discretely in his backpack, and used it to self-soothe in a trying new situation. I eventually got it back and have found it to be effective for its intended purpose. Now my son volunteers to clean the cast iron skillet!
customer_reviews.author: Summery

customer_reviews.title: Great cast iron pan cleaner.
customer_reviews.text: This works great to clean the food bits stuck to our cast iron pans. You cannot use detergent on cast iron pans so I use this stainless steal mesh with water to get the stuck on bits out of the pan. Then I clean the mesh with dish detergent and rinse real good.
customer_reviews.author: Honestly

customer_reviews.title: and it looks really cool like that
customer_reviews.text: This works really well: I hung it from a metal clip ring on my kitchen lower cabinet, and it looks really cool like that!
customer_reviews.author: cheryl

customer_reviews.title: It's Great! No scratches on the cast iron
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this for awhile now. It's Great! No scratches on the cast iron. Takes off grime and grit easily. It helps to heat water in the skillets prior to use. It seems like it loosens burnt stuff and makes clean up a bit quicker. Afterwards I add a couple of drops of dish soap and rinse the chain link cloth and dry it on a towel overnight.
customer_reviews.author: sigkap

customer_reviews.title: Works Great
customer_reviews.text: Workd great at cleaning my cast iron. It does hold the oils/greases you clean out of the cast iron, so you have to run it through the dishwasher after each use. And it seems to have a mind of it's own and will head straight down the drain if you let go of it. Other than that, a really good product that cleans your cast iron effectively and yet doesn't cause any damage to the seasoning you work so long and hard to get just right.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Work Horse on Cast Iron
customer_reviews.text: After seasoning and cooking with my new wok and skillet, making sure to wipe the oil and remnants out with a paper towel (after it has long cooled), adding warm water to the items and a few swishes around with this scrubber, and it's clean, clean, clean! I lightly season the cast iron again before putting it away, and it's ready for the next use. It also removed a slight haze on a glass bowl that I've used forever also. Over time, the dishwasher detergent leaves a film that doesn't wash off. My glass salad bowl has been restored to its former, shiny self.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel Keenan

customer_reviews.title: It's ok
customer_reviews.text: Pros- sturdy, easy to put away (space saving) Cons- greasy dried pan residue sticks to the rings and is difficult to clean, doesn't remove all food
customer_reviews.author: Tiffany Amber Dowling

customer_reviews.title: Cool item
customer_reviews.text: Purchased as a Christmas gift. It’s been used twice in 2 years. Too pretty to actually use. It hangs on display on the pot rack over the kitchen island and we explain its use to dinner guests who remark on its beauty and wonder what it’s for. But, as I say, although it does the job it’s intended for, we don’t like to get it dirty. We just like having it. Is that wrong?
customer_reviews.author: gkashnc

customer_reviews.title: Great for cleaning your cast iron pan, cleans well & doesn't leave any marks.
customer_reviews.text: What a great invention. We're new to the cast iron world, but I've been working in foodservice for about a year now & have seen a lot of cast iron pans in kitchens, & a good friend of mine swears by his cast iron pan & what he can create in it. So I bought my mom one for christmas & we've used it a few times but have no idea how to clean it. She bought some steel wool & it was ok but not great. Then I saw this thing on a daily deal & jumped. I've used it twice now & it's awesome, as a newby to cast iron, I wish I had this from the start.
customer_reviews.author: Ellie

customer_reviews.title: I wish I had a whole suit of it so I could slay a dragon.
customer_reviews.text: This is great. Gets our skillet clean in no time. To boot, if you get a pot with burned on black crust, a little bit of water, soap and this will get it off 5x faster than a steel wool pad (and won't get as nasty). Take note though, it will scratch metal, and will remove any nonstick coatings.
customer_reviews.author: Saboth

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: This is great on the cast-iron skillet. It cleans well without damaging, and it lets the pan keeps its oils. A word to the wise, from the not-so wise, don't let this slide itself into your garbage disposal, which it so stealthily finds a way to do. It may get jammed in there when you turn the disposal on and lose some of its pieces when you yank it out. Even after that, thankfully both the disposal and the cleaner still work!
customer_reviews.author: Jenny Allen

customer_reviews.title: This chain mail scrubber makes cast iron easy!
customer_reviews.text: Love this stainless ring cleaner. It gets gunk out of the pan without scratching the pan or cured surface. It does aggressively wear at the cure if you scrub hard for long but it is a perfect balance of get stuck stuff out without gouging the cured surface. The other thing I like is that if I use a scrubby pad or sponge scrubber on a gunky cast iron skillet with greasy residue in it then they are toast for cleaning anything else until they are thoroughly clean by hand and then go through the washing machine.
customer_reviews.author: Vips Patel

customer_reviews.title: Good but not great
customer_reviews.text: This product works well but it is hard to use. I bought another product, Blisstime Cast Iron Cleaner, and I prefer that one. The reason is because it has a sponge to help grip the chainmail and use a proper amount of force to get stuck items to remove.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Best scrubber ever for cast iron, carbon steel, and woks
customer_reviews.text: I was somewhat skeptical of using a chain mail cleaner on my cast iron. However, after reading the cooks illustrated review of a similar and more expensive product, I gave this item a shot. It works flawlessly on my cast iron skillets, carbon steel pans, and my wok. I have also used it on any number of other pots, pans, and baking items. My mother has already told me I will be getting her one for Christmas.
customer_reviews.author: Carl Johnson

customer_reviews.title: this cleans so good and its so easy to just wiggle in your ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought one for myself and my daughter. I saw some of these at our large dept store but it was about 1/3 the size of this. I have a lot of cast iron - this thing should have been in my life 40 years ago! this cleans so good and its so easy to just wiggle in your dishwater to clean it out. Its simple and just perfect. You won't be disappointed -
customer_reviews.author: Nelle

customer_reviews.title: Perfect mate for Iron
customer_reviews.text: I love having this thing, it's great to use in bottles and vases that I cant get my hand or a bottle brush into to clean. This is especially true for hummingbird feeders too. It's so easy to use, just drop in the bottle, maybe a little soap and water, and just gently shake and move around, it should remove all that gunk. And it has a great ring to hang up and drain. I've only had it a few days so Idk how durable it is, but if it's stainless steel, it should last. Seems pretty well made.
customer_reviews.author: Crystle Aquino

customer_reviews.title: Works but very smooth
customer_reviews.text: Very well made, looks great. Although it will likely last a lifetime I doubt it's abrasiveness will improve. It the links were stamps or ground with either or both having a flat edge it would scrape ten times as fast.
customer_reviews.author: tahotoy

customer_reviews.title: Good quality, good decontamination and descaling effect
customer_reviews.text: The quality is very good, the effect of decontamination and descaling is good, the decontamination ability is strong, the quality of cleaning all dirty things is guaranteed, the price is not expensive, the things are good, they don’t rust, and they can be wiped well. It has a good taste and a big brand is trustworthy. I am a person who recognizes that you must spend more money to buy good things. The quality is good and it is fun to use.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon Boyd

customer_reviews.title: The quality is good
customer_reviews.text: The workmanship is quite exquisite. I bought a large box several times. The quality of the goods is good, the size and thickness are very good, and it is convenient to use. It seems that it is packed in 10 pieces in a package. It is good to use and the price is cheap. It can be replaced regularly. The packaging, transportation and delivery speed are very fast. This kind of goods are not afraid of mailing time, as long as they are not damaged or lost.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: slider
customer_reviews.text: This works and is not messy like steal-wool. It does not make a big difference my cast iron pots but it cleans the stainless steel well. really needs a hook to keep it in place. I will easily slide off the middle divider in the sink well.
customer_reviews.author: Mercuiro P

customer_reviews.title: A great tool
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical at first, I do not use my cast iron because of having to clean it, but this makes it so easy. I have started using my fry pans again. I love them.
customer_reviews.author: F. Pate

customer_reviews.title: Worth having for cast iron!
customer_reviews.text: After years of washing w/dish soap, rinsing and putting on hot burner to dry, I have found something that cuts the rust tremendously. I will have to season it one more time and then it will be "cured." I bought 2 more as gifts. I keep mine in the box so it doesn't get all tangled up w/other things in drawer but so far, so good!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Looks and feels nice, like the ring to hang it.
customer_reviews.text: The cast iron cook ware kind of smashed up the box lol. But the good news there was no damage done to the item. I haven't had a chance to clean with it but head to replace the review cause I saw the pan and did the cat iron pan review here first. So will update the review after I test it out on actual cleaning.
customer_reviews.author: Ted

customer_reviews.title: Best tool for the job!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this item after reading reviews on Amazon on how great it was for cleaning and scrubbing cast irons or anything that does not have a nonstick material on it and boy they were not wrong. Immediately after using it for the first time, I can say that it works so much better than any scrubber I have ever used. Just need a bit of elbow grease and a lot of the crusted cooked on food is gone. Some items may need a bit more elbow grease, but it works! I'm pleased with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: fallndstny

customer_reviews.title: Game Changer!!!
customer_reviews.text: I hated cleaning my cast iron, so I didn't use them. I even bought aluminum liners for my Dutch ovens. But now I use my cast iron skillets every chance I get. This was amazing!!!!! I used to cheat and use hot water AND soap to get all the gunk out. No more. Just this and some warm water. No more re-coating w-oil every time I washed, because the soap stripped the seasoning.
customer_reviews.author: Someone

customer_reviews.title: For a really heavily soiled dutch oven product this cleaner ...
customer_reviews.text: For a really heavily soiled dutch oven product this cleaner will remove everything, but that was problem the cleaning removed more of the finish than I wanted. I would use this product sparingly and only when at least a light re-seasoning was available.
customer_reviews.author: boatersteve

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Just don’t let it fall into the garbage disposal. More to the point, don’t let your teenagers drop it in the disposal without telling anyone.
customer_reviews.author: ProudDad450

customer_reviews.title: It has lost a few of the little rings over the years but is still doing a good job. The rings are a little larger
customer_reviews.text: I didn't know these 'pot scratchers' were still made. I have one that belonged to my Mom in the thirties. We always used it when I was growing up. It has lost a few of the little rings over the years but is still doing a good job. The rings are a little larger. I think this 'scratcher', [Mama's name for it ] will give good service on the iron skillets for many years to come.
customer_reviews.author: Ouieta Morris, granmom

customer_reviews.title: ... I thought was just a gadget and had no great expectations it
customer_reviews.text: This I thought was just a gadget and had no great expectations it. I was really surprised when I used it. It works really well at getting off the old stuff and also cleaning off the new stuff. It does not hurt your hands at all when scrubbing with it, which I had feared. So happy with it.it.
customer_reviews.author: Anne

customer_reviews.title: Oh what fun!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is so neat. I love just playing with it. We have a lot of cast iron pots and pans as well as stainless steel and I'll need to stop playing with it and maybe wash some of these pots with it one of these days. But it's worth it as just a relaxation toy alone.
customer_reviews.author: Masha Bean

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for cast iron pan cleaning!
customer_reviews.text: This is so perfect for cleaning cast iron pans! My only regret is that I didn't get it sooner! Say goodbye to scratchy sponges that keep food inside of them and rot.
customer_reviews.author: BeckT

customer_reviews.title: Very helpful product
customer_reviews.text: This brush washer is really amazing is really.I didn't like washing dishes every time I cooked,because I knew it was really hard to clean up .Now that I have this product,I'd love to take the time to clean the pot carefully,because it doesn't take a long time to clean up.
customer_reviews.author: Mayra

customer_reviews.title: Must have cleaning tool!
customer_reviews.text: If my husband loves to use it means that it must be doing a good job. :) It really makes the cast iron cleaning very easy. We clean not only our pans but our cast iron griddle we use on our stove. Highly recommend for all your cast iron.
customer_reviews.author: Jojo

customer_reviews.title: Cleans amazingly well and doesn’t get Gunked up
customer_reviews.text: I can seriously clean any stuck on food from my cast iron cookware with this chain mail scrubber. I never use soap. Just add hot water and about a tablespoon of extra coarse rock salt. When the salt dissolved, scrub it for a few moments, maybe 45 seconds and rinse. Then wipe dry, heat the pan a bit and apply a light coat of oil. You’re done.
customer_reviews.author: Corrina

customer_reviews.title: Takes a bit of work to get the pan clean ...
customer_reviews.text: Takes a bit of work to get the pan clean but it does zero damage and leaves nothing behind in the way of dirt on the pan or metal shavings or brush bristles.
customer_reviews.author: Canadian Eh?

customer_reviews.title: Must have if you cook with cast iron
customer_reviews.text: where has this been all my life? I cook with cast iron a lot and this has made clean up so much easier. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: LDDR

customer_reviews.title: If anyone knows better, please let me know as there were no ...
customer_reviews.text: This works amazingly well on my cast iron skillet. I scrub the pan while it is still hot with hot water and it doesn't take much effort to clean. I've only been rinsing the Ringers with hot water to clean it as I'm afraid soap residue could get on the skillet the next time I clean it. If anyone knows better, please let me know as there were no directions with the box it came in.
customer_reviews.author: M. Hemming

customer_reviews.title: Love shinny pots and pans, get this!
customer_reviews.text: Love this! I used it not only for my cast iron cookware, work great also on stainless steel. It is easy to clean and free of debris. Never rust or foul smelling. Last of all, does not rough up the skin on my fingers!
customer_reviews.author: WM in Denver

customer_reviews.title: Perfection
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love this product! Never had an easier time cleaning my cast iron skillet.
customer_reviews.author: Britt

customer_reviews.title: The effect is very good
customer_reviews.text: The detergent is suitable for surface dirt such as ceramics, glass and stainless steel. After extrusion, the liquid will be foamed and used on the surface of the appliance. Then stand for five minutes and wipe it repeatedly with a cloth. The effect is very good, especially the stainless steel faucet, stove, a lot of rust stains can be removed, the taste is very light.
customer_reviews.author: Neil Nemeth

customer_reviews.title: Very durable
customer_reviews.text: Very nice for cleaning cast iron and stainless cookware. Also works great on bbq. Unlike steelwool, can easily be cleaned and used over and over again. Happy with purchase.
customer_reviews.author: opel02

customer_reviews.title: Like the shredded stainless steel scrubbers better
customer_reviews.text: Reading the reviews it seemed this would clean my cast iron skillet with some ease. I like the stainless steel shredded scrubbers better. Cuts the burned on bits better.
customer_reviews.author: J. Barker

customer_reviews.title: Easy to remove pot stains
customer_reviews.text: The quality is very good, the design is perfect, the quality is good, it is very strong, and does not take up space. It is comfortable to handle, comfortable to use, not easy to break, not to rust; easy to remove pot stains, oil stains, necessary for home cleaning
customer_reviews.author: David Bland

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use!
customer_reviews.text: Gift for my husband as he cooks, love cast iron but hates to clean the skillets.
customer_reviews.author: Chapsmac

customer_reviews.title: Worth price and harmless for your finger
customer_reviews.text: It’s good , may be more scotch on steel pot but harmless for your finger! Also good for iron pot. Worth the price too
customer_reviews.author: A

customer_reviews.title: You probably need this and you don't even know it...

product_meta.title: LauKingdom Cast Iron Cleaner, 7"x7" Stainless Steel Cast Iron Cleaner 316L Chainmail Scrubber for Cast Iron Pan, Round
feature_bullets: DURABLE & HYGIENIC - Cast iron cleaner is made of restaurant quality 316 grade stainless steel, which is food-safe and ultra-hygienic, unlike conventional germ-infested scrubbers. Chainmail scrubber combines machine soldered and handcrafted and lasts for at least 1 year.

WILL NOT SCRATCH YOUR PANS - Each ring is handmade with smooth edging for strength and comfort to protect the seasoning of your pans. It will not scratch your pans and keep your cast iron seasoned. It is made of 316L stainless steel with no worries to rust.

MULTIFUNCTIONAL - Used for cast iron, woks, casseroles, cookware items like a baking sheet, tea pot, cookie sheet, cauldron, tortilla press, cornbread, pie pan and more! A kitchen utensil & gadget Suitable for all kinds of cast iron pan kitchen cookware. Lightweight, and convenient for home, camping or travel.

EASY TO USE & CLEAN - The iron cast cleaner/cast iron pan cleaner/stainless steel cleaner/cast iron skillet cleaner/cast iron cleaner chainmail scrubber helps to effortlessly clean all your cast iron products and clean up just in 10 seconds when in warm water.
EASY TO STORE - You can hang it somewhere in the kitchen with no worries about losing it and dishwash safe.
